answer_html: Then there is at least one number c in \([a,b]\) satisfying \(f(c) = L\).
answer_latex:
Then there is at least one number
c in $[a,b]$ satisfying $f(c) = L$.
hints_html: Which letters appear in the conclusion of the theorem? Where do they belong in the opening statement of the theorem?
hints_latex:
Which letters appear in the conclusion of the theorem? Where do they
belong in the opening statement of the theorem?
hints_raw: Which letters appear in the conclusion of the theorem?  Where do they belong in the opening statement of the theorem?
question: 3 (a)
sols_html: Suppose the function \(f\) is continuous on the interval [a,b] and \(L\) is a number between \(f(a)\) and \(f(b)\). Then there is at least one number c in \([a,b]\) satisfying \(f(c) = L\).
sols_latex:
Suppose the function $f$ is continuous on the interval {[}a,b{]} and $L$
is a number between $f(a)$ and $f(b)$. Then there is at least one number
c in $[a,b]$ satisfying $f(c) = L$.
sols_raw: Suppose the function <math>f</math> is continuous on the interval <b>[a,b]</b> and <math>L</math> is a number between <math>f(a)</math> and <math>f(b)</math>.  Then there is at least one number <b>c</b> in <math>[a,b]</math> satisfying <math>f(c) = L</math>.
statement_html: Complete the statement of the Intermediate Value Theorem by filling in the blanks: Suppose the function \(f\) is continuous on the interval ____________ and \(L\) is a number between \(f(a)\) and \(f(b)\). Then there is at least one number _____________ in \([a,b]\) satisfying \(f(c) = L\).

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ and $L$ is a number between $f(a)$ and $f(b)$.
Then there is at least one number \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ in $[a,b]$
